Â•ΩÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºåÂè™ÊòØ‰πãÂâçÂú®ÊâÄÊúâÊàò‰ª§Ê∏∏ÊàèÈÉΩÂú®Êä¢Áé©ÂÆ∂Êó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÂΩì‰∏ãÁº∫‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ËÆ©‰∫∫ÊâìÂºÄÁöÑÁêÜÁî±„ÄÇ

Overwatch 2 an empty shell of what Overwatch used to be, a great game, not a perfect one but a game i could proudly call one of my favorite competitive games ( played over 1k hours on battle.net ) now i cant honestly recommend this game, we waited for 3 years with no content and they release this half assed game, and expect us to pay for characters on a "competitive" game, yes you can get them for free but unless you are planning to have this game as a secondary job you won't be getting them for free, also the new cosmetic system is so predatory i have over 20k coins of the old currency which i cant use on new skins or the battle pass. The sound as well they changed the sound of guns and some other stuff related to sound i would like to use the legacy sound the new sound is so garbage, there was 0 reason for them to mess with the sound, seems like they haven't heard of the saying "If it ain't broke don't fix it". I don't know for me it feels like the essence of Overwatch was lost the moment they released this game i would love to play Overwatch and not this garbage called Overwatch 2, i hate the fact that they forced the entire player-base to play their garbage sequel by completely removing Overwatch and replacing it with Overwatch 2, i paid to play Overwatch not Overwatch 2. BRING BACK OVERWATCH.
Oh how the mighty have fallen.

I have been playing Overwatch on and off since 2016 and now that it's on Steam and off the terrible bloatware that is Battle.net I can finally give this game the proper review it deserves.

I would honestly consider giving this game a mixed review if I could because there have been moments where I have genuinely enjoyed this game. But those moments have been overshadowed by this game's glaring issues, some of which are still problems even to this day. 

I will start off with one that has been a consistent annoyance to me: the balancing. The fact of the matter is that Blizzard cannot for the life of them figure out how to balance this game. Every season/update they make one hero totally overpowered while nerfing other heroes into the ground. It becomes so frustrating because you could have a character you enjoy playing suddenly become totally worthless because Blizzard over-corrected the nerf. And then you also have to deal with the hero that they over-corrected buffing who is now unstoppable. This leads me to another balancing issue which was the switch from 6v6 to 5v5. Every time I hop on this game with my friends it feels as though we're gambling with our fun because now that it's 5v5 it is way easier to steamroll the enemy team, which is obviously pretty fun. But at the same time it is also way easier to get steamrolled back. So now every night it's basically a coin toss if we're going to have an enjoyable evening or a frustrating night of getting completely stomped which is never fun.

I will now move on to my next point of frustration: the toxicity. This game from day one has had one of the worst fan-bases I have ever had the displeasure of interacting with. It basically boils down to a bunch of tryhards who will trash talk you in chat even in un-ranked matches. My friends and I have been embarrassed, insulted, and talked down to COUNTLESS times during our games, win or lose. I'm honestly probably just going to turn off chat all together because all I've seen it used for these days is for being toxic which honestly has just hindered my experience further.

Finally, I will talk about my last grievance with this game: The developers themselves and the controversy of this game being a sequel. Let me start off by saying flat out that this game is NOT a sequel. They basically took Overwatch 1, cleaned up the UI elements, removed lootboxes and added a terrible, greedy battlepass system that's incredibly tedious to grind. This "sequel" had fewer things in it at launch then when it released back in 2016 because they removed things like the on-fire system from the original game! And it's only now that we are getting the PVE gamemode that they promised and you have to pay EXTRA for it! This also is still a fraction of what they promised! There was going to be a full story with skill trees but what we got was basically the same stupid co-op missions they've put out before but now you have to pay extra for them?! What a joke! This game may be free, but they are constantly nickel and diming you for features that should be free. And I'm also just going to tell you DON'T GIVE THESE DEVELOPERS MONEY! There has been scandal after scandal of the devs doing deplorable things to their female employees and they should not be supported for that. The developers of this game are lying, manipulating sexual degenerates who are too busy drinking breast milk to balance the game properly and they will not be seeing another  cent out of me.

I don't like having to make a review like this but I think everyone deserves to know how screwed this game is. I have had fun moments playing this game, like when Lucioball comes around during the summer or those moments where the matchmaking puts us up against a team of our skill level instead of sweaty trash-talking tryhards. I want to enjoy this game so badly because the world, story, and characters are awesome, but the gameplay sucks so much. You can play this game if you want, it's free after all. But I wouldn't buy any of the cosmetics or PVE missions because that's just telling the devs that all of this is ok...

I cant wait to play Overwatch 2 PvE with the Skill Tree and hero talents on steam :)

It pains me to see what this game was become...
Blizzard stinks!

What a sad company You guys really want players in your game so badly huh? Literally adding content to the game could've saved it
But no you had to save it for "overwatch 2" what a joke... in reailty its the same game and you made it f2p and lastly you put it on steam 
nothing wrong being f2p makes it easy to get players but come on..20$? for a single skin thats a simple example but it just shows how greedy you are, even fortnite has better skins for less money
And putting your game on steam is a good idea its the best pc platform compared to your garbage battlenet launcher that gets ddosed 24/7 (i wonder why...)

Wheres the promised PvE? Oh "the scope simply grew too big"? Sure just admit you're all lazy and thats it, focusing on the main game you say? Oh my ass All of your balance changes are so questionable For example...Mccree
Yes im calling him that instead of cassidy i dont care, First you removed his stun to reduce CC in Ow2 Alright thats a brilliant start everyone liked the idea, but then you added that brain dead magnetic nade...that you can throw and easily stick it to a squishy enemy and shoot them once for a guaranteed kill...Nice one

Whats this? You're changing it again? Oh Alhamdulillah its gonna get nerfed right?

*becomes a literal homing missile and slows you down and removes your movement abilities*

Well done blizzard... What did i expect from a company who didnt even make weapon inspection a thing yet? its been 6 seasons...even mobile shooter games have them
Oh Yes blizzard you showed us weapon inspection in your trailer remember? and you still haven't added it, i know alzheimer's can be hard to deal with but come on you're a company now

i wanna see how a different better game is doing at this time of the year

Let's see Ah Team Fortress 2 a 16 year old game... Oh? it had a summer update and whats this? New content? No Team Fortress 3? Just new maps cosmetics and taunts?
And This single update made the game peak over 250k Players?!

Woah...so this whole time if i didnt make a meaningless sequel and actually added content my game gets more Players???

Who would've thought....

People need to stop crying "review bombing".  People have been upset with OW2 for a while, with very good reason.


They lied, they started charging $20+ for a single skin you used to be able to earn through game play, they added a boring game mode, they cycle out maps people like, they said they would offer PvE then didn't but are selling missions here and there, no more hero mode with leveling up, all after letting the base game die for 2 years with no updates, I mean I could go on and on.  There are so many reason people legit are upset at OW2, and they deserve all the hate they're getting.  I'm glad that their cheap attempt to pump numbers through Steam is getting them smashed, good, they reap what they sow.

las ratas fans de TF2 estan mas atentos de ow que los fans de ow XD
sinceramente,si vienes nuevo al juego como lo fui yo cuando salio ow,juegalo es muy divertido y tiene una gran cantidad de contenido,muchos heroes muy diferentes,mapas,modos de juego,el arcade y los modos personalizados.
el evidente problema en ow2 es el precio de la tienda los cuales tienen que cambiar.Pero amigo,el juego no es solo las skins me pasa igual con Fornite,no eh comprado nunca una skin,y eso no me impide disfrutar el juego.
